caption: The image features a close-up portrait of a man smiling gently towards the camera. He wears a black cap tilted to one side and a plaid shirt over a white undershirt. His facial features include visible wrinkles and rough skin texture, indicating an aged appearance, and some dirt or grime is visible on his forehead and cheek, suggesting he might have been engaged in physical or outdoor work. His hair, visible under the cap, is unkempt and matted. The background of the photo is blurry and indistinct but appears to be an outdoor setting with a muted light blue or gray sky. The focus and lighting in the image emphasize the man's features, particularly his face, capturing a sense of ruggedness and warmth.
title: In August 1973, a major forest fire swept through 17,470 acres of the western slopes of the Sierra Mountain Range near Sonora. A "cat skinner" in the burn area known as "Granite Fire." Cat skinners chain logs to caterpillar tractors. The "cat" then pulls logs to "landing area" for loading onto trucks.
